alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Merrimack; Southern Carroll; Southern Grafton; Strafford; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 3:27PM EST until January 05 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTRY PRECIPITATION TO MAKE FOR SLIPPERY TRAVEL TONIGHT AND THURSDAY... .Low pressure will move south of New England later today and tonight. It will initially start as rain except for in the mountains where snow and sleet is likely with some freezing rain possible. Eventually colder air works southward across the entire region tonight changing the precipitation to a mix of light snow, sleet, and freezing rain which should continue through at least Thursday morning allowing for slippery travel. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations up to one inch and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of south central, southwest, and western Maine. Portions of central and northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From Midnight tonight to Noon EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...A period of mixed precipitation is expected tonight into Thursday with air temperatures falling below freezing after midnight. Expect slippery road conditions and avoid travel if possible. A slippery Thursday morning commute is expected with slippery conditions perhaps continuing into the afternoon and evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
